intro: Himantoglossum longibracteatum var. siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian hare’s foot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique, hairy, and often reddish-brown leaves. The plant produces striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, sunny habitats and is adapted to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
